metadata.title: CVE-2024-43826 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nfs: pass explicit offset/count to trace eventsnfs_folio_length is unsafe to use without having the folio locked and acheck for a NULL ->f_mapping that protects against truncations and canlead to kernel crashes.  E.g. when running xfstests generic/065 withall nfs trace points enabled.Follow the model of the XFS trace points and pass in an expl?cit offsetand length.  This has the additional benefit that these values canbe more accurate as some of the users touch partial folio ranges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
